headline: Stock Market Today: Dow, Nasdaq Post Large Losses; 'Big Short' Burry Bets Against Palantir, Nvidia (Live Coverage)
summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average and other major stock indexes ended the session with hefty losses Tuesday as valuation worries hit highflying tech stocks. Among the fallen, Nvidia and Palantir Technologies fell on the stock market today after "Big Short" investor Michael Burry disclosed bets against the artificial intelligence leaders.

Among the fallen, Nvidia and Palantir Technologies fell on the stock market today after "Big Short" investor Michael Burry disclosed bets against the artificial intelligence leaders.

headline: What Catalysts Could Shift the Narrative for IBM Amid Evolving Analyst Views?
summary: International Business Machines (IBM) stock has seen its fair value price target decrease slightly, from $287.70 down to $287.09, following the latest analyst commentary. This modest adjustment reflects a blend of optimism surrounding IBM’s strengths in quantum computing and consulting. However, there are concerns about the pace of software growth and market valuation. Stay tuned to discover how investors can monitor these evolving perspectives and make informed decisions in the shifting...

headline: Kyndryl's second-quarter revenue declines amid contract renegotiations
summary: The company, formerly IBM's infrastructure services business, has been restructuring several no-margin contracts it inherited from Big Blue to generate higher profits, but at the cost of revenue growth.  The sales decline reflects "progress in reducing inherited no-margin and low-margin third-party content in customer contracts, as well as longer sales cycles," the company said in a statement.  Kyndryl's software services help businesses conduct day-to-day operations and enable artificial intelligence integration.

content.title: Kyndryl's second-quarter revenue declines amid contract renegotiations
content.summary: The company, formerly IBM's infrastructure services business, has been restructuring several no-margin contracts it inherited from Big Blue to generate higher profits, but at the cost of revenue growth.  The sales decline reflects "progress in reducing inherited no-margin and low-margin third-party content in customer contracts, as well as longer sales cycles," the company said in a statement.  Kyndryl's software services help businesses conduct day-to-day operations and enable artificial intelligence integration.

headline: AMD Reports Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: SANTA CLARA, Calif., Nov. 04, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) today announced financial results for the third quarter of 2025. Third quarter revenue was a record $9.2 billion, gross margin was 52%, operating income was $1.3 billion, net income was $1.2 billion and diluted earnings per share was $0.75. On a non-GAAP(*) basis, gross margin was 54%, operating income was $2.2 billion, net income was $2 billion and diluted earnings per share was $1.20. Our third quarter results did not incl

headline: IBM reportedly cutting thousands of jobs
summary: Investing.com -- International Business Machines Corp. plans to cut thousands of workers during the fourth quarter as the company continues to shift its focus toward higher-growth software and services, according to a Bloomberg report on Tuesday.

content.title: IBM reportedly cutting thousands of jobs
content.summary: Investing.com -- International Business Machines Corp. plans to cut thousands of workers during the fourth quarter as the company continues to shift its focus toward higher-growth software and services, according to a Bloomberg report on Tuesday.

headline: IBM to cut thousands of jobs in fourth quarter amid software focus
summary: "In the fourth quarter we are executing an action that will impact a low single-digit percentage of our global workforce."  Under CEO Arvind Krishna, IBM has doubled down on software as it looks to tap into increased spending on cloud services through its "Red Hat" division, as businesses integrate AI technology.  However, IBM last month recorded a slowdown in growth in the key cloud software segment, raising alarm bells among investors betting heavily on Big Blue's ability to benefit more from booming cloud services demand.

content.title: IBM to cut thousands of jobs in fourth quarter amid software focus
content.summary: "In the fourth quarter we are executing an action that will impact a low single-digit percentage of our global workforce."  Under CEO Arvind Krishna, IBM has doubled down on software as it looks to tap into increased spending on cloud services through its "Red Hat" division, as businesses integrate AI technology.  However, IBM last month recorded a slowdown in growth in the key cloud software segment, raising alarm bells among investors betting heavily on Big Blue's ability to benefit more from booming cloud services demand.

thumbnail.caption: The IBM logo is pictured during the Viva Tech start-up and technology summit in Paris

headline: IBM to Cut Thousands of Roles in Focus on Software Growth
summary: “We routinely review our workforce through this lens and at times rebalance accordingly,” a company spokesperson said.  “In the fourth quarter we are executing an action that will impact a low single-digit percentage of our global workforce.”  IBM shares have climbed this year on investor enthusiasm for the software business, which is fueled by acquired divisions Red Hat and HashiCorp.

content.title: IBM to Cut Thousands of Roles in Focus on Software Growth
content.summary: “We routinely review our workforce through this lens and at times rebalance accordingly,” a company spokesperson said.  “In the fourth quarter we are executing an action that will impact a low single-digit percentage of our global workforce.”  IBM shares have climbed this year on investor enthusiasm for the software business, which is fueled by acquired divisions Red Hat and HashiCorp.

headline: How big is IBM’s quantum opportunity?
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley said in a note Tuesday that it now sees a larger potential market for quantum computing following IBM’s recent investor event, but cautioned that commercialization remains years away and fraught with uncertainty.

headline: CDW beats quarterly profit estimates on strong demand for its IT solutions
summary: IT solutions provider CDW beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit on Tuesday, as enterprise customers increased tech budgets and embraced artificial intelligence cloud adoption. Growing demand for AI-related cloud and infrastructure to support intensive computing has boosted the need for CDW's IT solutions, which include hardware, software and services for sectors like healthcare, government and education. CDW's chief financial officer, Albert Miralles, said strong performance in services and cloud was a key driver of growth and margins in the quarter.

content.title: CDW beats quarterly profit estimates on strong demand for its IT solutions
content.summary: IT solutions provider CDW beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter profit on Tuesday, as enterprise customers increased tech budgets and embraced artificial intelligence cloud adoption. Growing demand for AI-related cloud and infrastructure to support intensive computing has boosted the need for CDW's IT solutions, which include hardware, software and services for sectors like healthcare, government and education. CDW's chief financial officer, Albert Miralles, said strong performance in services and cloud was a key driver of growth and margins in the quarter.

This new agreement deepens a strategic collaboration that began between the two companies in 2018. headline: DNSFilter Expands Global Reach through Strategic Partnership with Midis Group to Enhance Cybersecurity Solutions
summary: DNSFilter, a global leader in protective DNS and content filtering, announced today a strategic partnership with Midis Group to provide enhanced cybersecurity solutions to customers across Eastern Europe, the Middle East and Africa. This partnership will empower organizations in these regions to safeguard their networks against evolving online threats through a cutting-edge, cloud-based platform known for its real-time threat detection and intuitive management.

This partnership will empower organizations in these regions to safeguard their networks against evolving online threats through a cutting-edge, cloud-based platform known for its real-time threat detection and intuitive management.
